calculateRetryableSubmissionFee(uint256,.details: This fee can be paid by funds already in the L2 aliased address or by the current message valueThis formula may change in the future, to future proof your code query this method instead of inlining!!

params.baseFee: The block basefee when the retryable is included in the chain, if 0 current block.basefee will be used
params.dataLength: The length of the retryable's calldata, in bytes

createRetryableTicket(address,uint256,ui.details: all msg.value will deposited to callValueRefundAddress on L2Gas limit and maxFeePerGas should not be set to 1 as that is used to trigger the RetryableData error

params.callValueRefundAddress: l2Callvalue gets credited here on L2 if retryable txn times out or gets cancelled. In case this address is a contract, funds will be received in its alias on L2.
params.data: ABI encoded data of L2 message
params.excessFeeRefundAddress: the address which receives the difference between execution fee paid and the actual execution cost. In case this address is a contract, funds will be received in its alias on L2.
params.gasLimit: Max gas deducted from user's L2 balance to cover L2 execution. Should not be set to 1 (magic value used to trigger the RetryableData error)
params.l2CallValue: call value for retryable L2 message
params.maxFeePerGas: price bid for L2 execution. Should not be set to 1 (magic value used to trigger the RetryableData error)
params.maxSubmissionCost: Max gas deducted from user's L2 balance to cover base submission fee

returns._0: unique message number of the retryable transaction

depositEth().details: This does not trigger the fallback function when receiving in the L2 side.      Look into retryable tickets if you are interested in this functionality.This function should not be called inside contract constructors

postUpgradeInit(address).details: function to be called one time during the inbox upgrade process      this is used to fix the storage slots

sendL1FundedUnsignedTransactionToFork(ui.details: This method can only be called upon L1 fork and will not alias the caller      This method will revert if not called from origin

sendL2Message(bytes).details: This method can be used to send any type of message that doesn't require L1 validation

params.messageData: Data of the message being sent

sendL2MessageFromOrigin(bytes).details: This method is an optimization to avoid having to emit the entirety of the messageData in a log. Instead validators are expected to be able to parse the data from the transaction's input

params.messageData: Data of the message being sent

sendUnsignedTransactionToFork(uint256,ui.details: This method can only be called upon L1 fork and will not alias the caller      This method will revert if not called from origin

sendWithdrawEthToFork(uint256,uint256,ui.details: This method can only be called upon L1 fork and will not alias the caller      This method will revert if not called from origin

unsafeCreateRetryableTicket(address,uint.details: Same as createRetryableTicket, but does not guarantee that submission will succeed by requiring the needed funds come from the deposit alone, rather than falling back on the user's L2 balanceAdvanced usage only (does not rewrite aliases for excessFeeRefundAddress and callValueRefundAddress). createRetryableTicket method is the recommended standard.Gas limit and maxFeePerGas should not be set to 1 as that is used to trigger the RetryableData error

params.callValueRefundAddress: l2Callvalue gets credited here on L2 if retryable txn times out or gets cancelled
params.data: ABI encoded data of L2 message
params.excessFeeRefundAddress: the address which receives the difference between execution fee paid and the actual execution cost
params.gasLimit: Max gas deducted from user's L2 balance to cover L2 execution. Should not be set to 1 (magic value used to trigger the RetryableData error)
params.l2CallValue: call value for retryable L2 message
params.maxFeePerGas: price bid for L2 execution. Should not be set to 1 (magic value used to trigger the RetryableData error)
params.maxSubmissionCost: Max gas deducted from user's L2 balance to cover base submission fee

returns._0: unique message number of the retryable transaction

calculateRetryableSubmissionFee(uint256,.notice: Get the L1 fee for submitting a retryable

createRetryableTicket(address,uint256,ui.notice: Put a message in the L2 inbox that can be reexecuted for some fixed amount of time if it reverts

depositEth().notice: Deposit eth from L1 to L2 to address of the sender if sender is an EOA, and to its aliased address if the sender is a contract

isAllowed(address).notice: check if user is in allowList

sendL2Message(bytes).notice: Send a generic L2 message to the chain

sendL2MessageFromOrigin(bytes).notice: Send a generic L2 message to the chain

sendWithdrawEthToFork(uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Send a message to initiate L2 withdrawal

setAllowList(address[],bool[]).notice: add or remove users from allowList

unsafeCreateRetryableTicket(address,uint.notice: Put a message in the L2 inbox that can be reexecuted for some fixed amount of time if it reverts
